intro: Discaria weddelliana, commonly known as the Weddell's discaria, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Discaria weddelliana is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
